website_summaries.verdict: Even bigger, rowdier dogs will love this 18'-long tunnel.
pros: Owners were pleasantly surprised with how long it held up despite consistent use by bigger dogs
Smarter dogs will get excited when you pull this out of storage because they know how much fun it can be
Perfect for those looking to master agility training from home
cons: Some reported disappointment in the parts — broken zipper, some tearing to the fabric

customer_reviews.title: Dog Approved
customer_reviews.text: My daughter & her dog love it! My little girl has created an agility course in our back yard for her dog. She's made homemade hurdles & weave poles using PVC pipes. Now she has this huge tunnel. Her dog loves it & runs through it with ease. Her first tunnel was a cheap/small kids tunnel from Ikea. This one is 3Xs as long! Only complaint: The stakes are wimpy. They bent as she pushed them into the ground (didn't use a hammer -simply pushed by hand.) We'll have to buy some camping stakes. Hope I was helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Picky Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Tore within minutes
customer_reviews.text: My dog walked through this ten times before one of the tabs for the stakes tore right off. Also, as mentioned in other reviews, the stakes are extremely cheap and bent before I could even push them into the grass in my backyard with my hands. The wires also busted through its casing - again, after very light use on grass. I contacted the seller, but they did not respond. Extremely disappointed in this low quality product and nonexistent customer service, not to mention it is a hassle to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for using at full length, but doesn't adapt to smaller very well.
customer_reviews.text: The tunnel is probably not what I was looking for. My hope was that having an 18' tunnel, I could size it down to smaller or use it as a longer tunnel. I like that it can be S-shaped or rounded, but it doesn't compress into a smaller size very well. A regulation tunnel has the braces about 4" apart; These are twice as wide so when compressing, the fabric inside hangs down and obstructs the tunnel itself. I haven't yet figured out how to compensate for that. On the positive side, it's lightweight and stores flat, though it takes a few minutes to get inside the case.
customer_reviews.author: Joi de Vivre

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Easy But Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: Love that I can set up and tear down in minutes, but the trade off in durability is not worth it. The spikes it comes with bend too easily, and using stronger spikes that actually stay in the ground cause the attachment bits on the tunnel to rip off in a matter of 2-5 uses. I maybe have three attachment bits still on the tunnel. Maybe if you used tunnel bags it would be better. Overall, you get what you pay for, and the price really can’t be beat if you don’t mind some additional jerryrigging.
customer_reviews.author: Mia GulanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Agility Training Tunnel
customer_reviews.text: I love the tunnel. It is Medium grade material- withstands our dogs running through it. Long enough to put a curve in it when it is set up. Fold up easily. 2 Problems with it- 1. you can not shorten the tunnel to make it less than 18 feet because the extra material between the supports crumples up INSIDE the tunnel and makes the pathway slightly obstructed and smaller and confusing for the dogs. 2. the anchors are only 6 inches long and flimsy- they easily pull out of the ground. I had to replace them with heavy duty tent stakes to anchor the tunnel. I still would recommend this tunnel for the average family training their noncompetitive pets.
customer_reviews.author: blondbikernurse

customer_reviews.title: handle problem
customer_reviews.text: First of all, We love our new tunnel. My 8 month old puppy immediately thought it was great! Both diameter and length are exactly as described,It also came really fast which is so appreciated during this pandemic! Now the only reason it did not get 5 stars! When I opened the box the first thing I discovered. One of the handles on the cover it's in, is totally torn off! I can't understand how, however packed the item did not notice this problem. I sew, so of course I will re-attach the handle. I will be hoping the stitching on the tunnel is more durable. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top 3 all time favorite for my pack of Pomeranians.  They LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: Every once in a while there that special purchase that brings great joy to the house! Enter this agility tunnel. Wow, so much fun! I have several tiny Pomeranians (one who is going to show for agility). They all have a blast with this thing, as do I :) We use this indoors and it stays pretty stable without being staked down. For larger or more hyperactive dogs, or seasoned agility dogs, this fabric might be a bit on the sheer side. Not sure how long it would hold up with rougher treatment, but PERFECT for my pack of Poms. BE WARNED: The dimensions are accurate! It takes up my entire living room.
customer_reviews.author: Chele

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: My service dog needs constant challenges or he gets bored. He’ a border collie & is very smart. Went straight through from just the second try! My only issue is that the spikes provided are very cheep & ineffectual. The slightest breeze makes it role. I’m not going to pay so much more for sand bags, but would have paid more for the following described item. Try making them stronger & perhaps able to be screwed into the ground like some tie out cables are.
customer_reviews.author: S. W.

customer_reviews.title: Light and portable
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to buy our dog an agility tunnel for training. This was the perfect starter for us. We put it in our backyard which is pretty small and have him run through it for treats. The tunnel is the perfect length in our dog just run loves running through it. It has little tags off the side to be able to pin it to the ground but we didn’t need to do that. When it starts to rain outside all we do is roll it up and put it back in the house. It is very lightweight and very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Jean

customer_reviews.title: Unresponsive seller
customer_reviews.text: Tunnel arrived with a damaged cover. It was used about 4 times and the cover zipper broke and tunnel started to show signs of tearing.Seller responded very quickly that a replacement would be sent but that was over 3 weeks ago and nothing. My emails are also being ignored. It is very lightweight and hard to secure to the ground. If you are looking for something for light use it may work for you.
customer_reviews.author: North Shore Girl

customer_reviews.title: Good for Practice
customer_reviews.text: Nice tunnel, my dog loves it! It’s not the best material, it quite thin so I don’t know how much it will last. If you have a rough dog you might need something thicker. Also, the metal parts to stick it to the ground are pretty useless. Once the dog goes through the tunnel they come off. I suggest longer and thicker anchors. My dog is a 50lbs Pointer (all legs!) and had no problem going through it. She had a blast! It’s great for practice!
customer_reviews.author: Sofia D

customer_reviews.title: Already broke after only a few uses!
customer_reviews.text: Stitching unraveled on end and coil disconnected and is poking out. In center, coil disconnected and poked hole through fabric and is exposed. Stitching on other end also not solid stitching and ready to unravel. Unable to reach seller from this page to discuss defective product. I know others who have gotten this and been very happy. I just think this one slipped through quality control. Would love to discuss replacement with seller.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy for dogs, kids, and adults
customer_reviews.text: This tunnel is an incredible buy and exactly what I was looking for. I bought it for my dog and I (we are agility beginners, she is a 40 lb Aussie x heeler mix) and it is perfect for us! As soon as it came in the mail however, my kids got it out and played for hours. The tunnel is very durable. Despite the kids and the dog going through it 100 times it still looks like new. It’s lightweight and easy to pack in the enclosed bag. 5 stars! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Ripped on first use.
customer_reviews.text: We literally used this one time and it was fun but it ripped and the wire frame popped out Of the end making it dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Oakley Goldman

customer_reviews.title: So Much Fun, Puppy Approved
customer_reviews.text: Have a Goldendoodle puppy and with temperatures climbing outside to the 100s, I bought this tunnel for her to blow off steam. She loves it! In maniac mode she will take her stuffed toy on a circuit around the living room, through the tunnel multiple times. As she gets older and it gets cooler we will build other agility equipment for her, but now the 18’ long tunnel is perfect
customer_reviews.author: SW Utah

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for rough dogs with nails
customer_reviews.text: Was excited about trying this out with my k9s but 5 minutes after using it, there were 5 holes and one of the clips to keep the tunnel folded was missing bc my dogs went through it. Honestly don’t know how it ripped off. Maybe better for little dogs with not so long nails
customer_reviews.author: Charmae T

customer_reviews.title: Well made East to fold large enough for 205 lb man to get through.
customer_reviews.text: My Australian Cobberdog puppy at 8 weeks old has not had the courage to go through this 18’-0 agility tunnel yet. Ultimately she will and be on her way through an agility course that I’ll set up my n my property. This is a beautiful tunnel well made I know because my 43 year old daughter- went through it trying to convince the puppy- with flying colors.
customer_reviews.author: A. Provenz

customer_reviews.title: Bought to move cool air up from basement
customer_reviews.text: We have a wonderfully cool basement and a warmer upstairs. We bought this and put it at the bottom of the stairs by a strong fan, then placed the upper end in our kitchen. In 30 minutes of running the fan the temperature in the kitchen dropped nearly four degrees. Best thing we have ever purchased! And if we get a dog then we will have an agility tunnel!
customer_reviews.author: WCO6

customer_reviews.title: Slick Material
customer_reviews.text: This material is probably okay for any dog that doesn't actually run through, but if they do, watch out. Super slick under paw and the material doesn't bode well for durability. Pros: fast shipping and easy-to-pack in the included bag Cons: Slick material, non-durable material, small in diameter for any med-large or larger dog Will keep for puppies to explore before they go to their fur-ever homes.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tunnel for not only teaching my 5 week old ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tunnel for not only teaching my 5 week old litter of puppies but also for the adult dogs to play with. I had anchors to anchor it down but if you order this product and don't have them you do need to add them to your purchase. Not sand bags just metal pin anchors to keep it from blowing around. Very light weight, easy to set up and take down. All my dogs love the new toy! A busy dog is a happy dog!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Penwell

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for dog agility training.
customer_reviews.text: I train dogs for AKC obedience and agility. I bought this tunnel to be part of the training regimen for dogs new to agility. For a dog new to the experience you must be able to shorten (compress) the tunnel so they are not as intimidated to traveling through the first few times. You can not collapse this tunnel for that purpose. Plus, if you try, the fabric is so light that it falls into the tunnel and effectively blocks the way. This might be a good toy for kids, but it is marginal for any training purpose.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves agility tunnels and this one is great for a home backyard!
customer_reviews.text: Starting tunnel agility with your dog? Compared to going all out with a more professional dog tunnel, this one is a great start at a decent price. It's a piece of agility equipment not made with PVC, so it has to be taken in from the weather. This is one of my Collie's favorite things to do....race through it!
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Barbara

customer_reviews.title: It's well worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is great. We've used it many times for agility practice at home with my 50lb aussie and no rips, tears- nothing! It's holding up really well (esp compared to their chute) and I'm very pleased. Great for the price and it's about regulation length so that's good! Only thing I can complain about is that the metal stakes are SUPER flimsy... as in, will completely bend out of shape when putting them into even the grass. But I've made it work. I'll buy some better stakes at some point. This folds up very flat for storage. I keep it in the trunk of my car.
customer_reviews.author: The Little Mogul Toy Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the material began to tear away from the wire coil at the end of the first week, BUT we have 2 pit bulls and one is just going to be 1 year old so I have to put that into Consideration- they had tons of fun and that's what counts. Let's just say I am having the 2nd one delivered tomorrow!!
customer_reviews.author: Basha

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHAT IS PICTURED
customer_reviews.text: Picture shows full coiled tube with no collapsed fabric. What I received had about 4 feet of coiled tube with the remaining 18' just collapsible fabric. I'll be returning it. I wanted a fully open agility tube. I got exactly the opposite of what I wanted. I even looked at the collapsed ones and chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Ard

customer_reviews.title: Durable for several years and great for dogs/cats of all sizes!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the first tunnel in 2013 for my Aussie puppies. They LOVED it and played in it for several years. It finally fell apart, but it was not because of quality, it was due to being left out in the weather and extreme play inside and out!. They ran through it, played on top of it, and eventually tore it from the wires. I mended it and it is used today by my little Pomeranians. I am purchasing another one just because they need a new one. The old one brought hours of joy, but I think it is time to retire it. Your dogs and cats will love this tunnel no matter the size.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie Mae

customer_reviews.title: will not last long
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this tunnel did not last more than a couple weeks. I own a doggy daycare and it was ruined within the first three days of using it. The stitching fell apart after a few dogs ran through it and now it is completely falling apart so we will have to throw away because the metal rods are sticking out. It was fun while it lasted but not durable at all.
customer_reviews.author: barks_n_bres

customer_reviews.title: Low cost tunnel for occasional use and initial training
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tunnel for our Border Collie pup. He dove right in and loves it. It comes with metal pins to stake it to the ground in key places and it holds up fairly well. Minus 1 star as it will rip and tear at the stake down points after heavy use as they are not reinforced but if your pet just runs through it (no puppy play of jumping on it, chasing other dogs, etc) it should last a long time. Price was right for what we needed it for (introduction to tunnels) and it comes with a carrying case which makes transport easy.
customer_reviews.author: Alex N

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money and fun for dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great training tool for our 6 month old Border Collie. The tunnel arrived collapsed making it very easy to store. We staked the tunnel out in our yard using provided stakes and began training our dog. We began by throwing a toy through the tunnel to lure our dog through while simultaneously using the phrase "go through". He had mastered this tunnel by the end of the day. The tunnel stake outs do get stressed and one has been ripped so far but this is due to our energetic and over enthusiastic dog. Overall, it is a great way to burn off his energy and it is fun for him to play with.
customer_reviews.author: mcons

customer_reviews.title: Dogs had fun, quality can improve
customer_reviews.text: The dogs loved it! A wire popped out within a months, so it’s cheaply made. But if you want to figure out if your dog likes this kind of toy, then it’s worth it before spending more on a better quality one. Also, it comes with nails to secure it on the grass so it doesn’t move, but it keeps coming off. I tried it several times and it didn’t work. Because it wasn’t secure in the ground, it keeps rolling around and it got sooooo dirty. Overall, my dogs had fun and so I do not regret getting this item.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: When this thhing arrived in a 2" wide box, ...
customer_reviews.text: When this thhing arrived in a 2" wide box, I was skeptical. Seriously, how could there be 18' of tunnel in there? Then I opened it up, and the tunnel just kept expanding, and expanding, and expanding. Yup, it's 18' of tunnel that stores in the same size bag as my 6' kids play tunnels. So far it has survived backyard agility practice with a crazed cattledog and border collie. It does need to be staked down though, and the little stakes included may not do the job. You may want to invest in some additional tunnel holding devices for added stability.
customer_reviews.author: Ned

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun for Goats
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my goats and they love it. Day 1 they were running thru it and jumping on it. It’s been outside with them for over a month and still holding up with all their abuse. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy this for agility training, but for fun for the dogs, and they love it! We don't even anchor it to the ground. It rolls around the yard on windy days and seems to make even more fun for the dogs. It's holding up very well also.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for all sizes
customer_reviews.text: I’m a pet nanny and have a variety of size dogs come play and my own dog a Great Pyrenees fits and loves going in and out Did 20 times on his own the second day first day took a moment and then was all about it Great size and adaptable for any shape
customer_reviews.author: Donna Mac

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun for the Yorkies!
customer_reviews.text: I have three Yorkshire Terriers and this tunnel has provided hours of play. They use it as both an escape path and a place to hide. I haven't even used the ground stakes as leaving the tunnel to move around the yard has added another dimension to their play, not only chasing each other, but predicting where the entrance will be as it rolls across the yard pushed by the wind. The carrying case is great and it collapses back into its carrying form very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Notrab Drahcir

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight makes it harder to work with, zipper broke.
customer_reviews.text: The zipper on the storage case broke on first use. The tunnel can still be stored in it, but not as nicely and conveniently. This is a very lightweight tunnel so it move around a lot when being used. U put a weight at each end but the middle needed bracing. If you thing you might want to shorten it since 18 feet is very long, I wasn’t able to, as the opening tipped down when the spring was compressed.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa G Green

customer_reviews.title: I would buy a more durable one for training.
customer_reviews.text: To light weight, will not stay still with grass stakes. Dogs run through and tunnel moves. I have not figured out how I am going to secure it yet. I do not think it will last long because thin and my bigger dog went through it and about put a hole in it with his head when it rolled. Would work better for dogs that are trained already.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Teague

customer_reviews.title: You definitely could not put the weights on the ends like they do in school (to keep tunnel in place)it ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this indoors and although my dog is 23 pounds and definitely not dainty mine is on carpet. He loves it but it is very flimsy and probably would not withstand using outdoors or with a larger dog! You definitely could not put the weights on the ends like they do in school (to keep tunnel in place)it would collapse but for my 23 pound dog on the carpet it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great chicken tunnel.  :)
customer_reviews.text: Well here's a story for you. I bought this to use as a chicken tunnel. The chickens adjusted to it Pretty quickly. I am going to have to support it a little because it wasn't designed to be suspended in the air for 3-5 feet. Photos to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Easy to lay out and dogs enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: Only issue I found was the little metal stakes that come with it are useless, thing flys around back yard. I had some ground stakes that fit in the holders just fine so wasnt real issue for me. With better ground stakes its perfect in place.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about this one. I have 2 pretty large malamutes 90 lbs each. They fit easily! I tried to show them how to go through by crawling in. They dog piled on me and smacked and scratched the tunnel. I was sure it would be ruined. Nope! Great shape. If it can withstand my little monsters, it can withstand anything. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: andi

customer_reviews.title: it's very lightweight and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what I wanted for my young puppy. First, it's very lightweight and easy to set up. It probably would be challenging for outdoor use during inclement weather, but for our patio, or rec room its a great way to entertain her during winter time. It has pegs for when we will use outdoor, through we have not tried that yet. It easily fits back into the carry case making it quick to put away or take with us. I'm not a professional agility trainer and so I cannot comment on its suitability for that. But as an introduction to agility for my young GSD as well as fun inside/outside play this was a VERY GOOD find.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer b

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: My dog was so excited when I set this up. Tunnels are his favorite and since I got this, our agility training has made progress. The tunnel is pretty high quality, but I feel it is best for the tunnel to pick it up after each training session. It is easy to curve and maneuver. I made homemade sandbags to go around it, because my dog hits the tunnel hard. He is a 55 pound border collie mix and the tunnel is holding up well to his usage. My dog is very grateful and I am happy with it too!
customer_reviews.author: RachelTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Jumped on and ran through
customer_reviews.text: As far as durability I cannot speak to years, but my lab mix likes to "attack” the other dogs as they run through. She has not managed to "breach the hull yet". It can accommodate two medium sized dogs as they race through and maybe stop for doggie tea and or slap fight in the middle. This is a narrow playground for my crew. A great purchase so far and able to withstand dogs who want to play with and in it rather complete an agility exercise course. I am laughing as I write this day later; I hope your dogs have as much fun as my crew.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Meanface

customer_reviews.title: It's Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a long, perfectly sized tunnel! My dog loves it. She's a 42 pound rottie/healer and the opening is plenty big for her. The hooks to tie it down to the ground work well if you want to adjust the shape and have the tunnel wrap is a circle. It is sturdy and I love that it fits back in the storage bag without a lot of fuss. I would highly recommend this for anyone looking to agility train their dogs. My cat also loves to tease the dog by sitting in the middle and taunting the dogs to come and get her. I would make this purchase again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Bree Long

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun. Watch out for stake holes
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my new pup. Lots of fun and he enjoys running through it and jumping on it. Just watch out that the stakes may not hold it down with an aggressive dog and the dog may bite off the metal part of the holes. I wound up cutting them off but we can still use it no problem.
customer_reviews.author: J Nash

customer_reviews.title: extremely poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I received this yesterday -- YESTERDAY -- and it already has a tear in it. There were also only five tabs attached with which to affix it to the ground, and three of those have already torn off. (I have two beagles, so not the most rambunctious dogs.) There is no explanation for how poor the construction is on this product. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: Held up in a windstorm (with additional weight to keep it in place.)
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy! I leave my tunnel outside in the yard full time held in place with a patio paver at each end. We had a huge windstorm come through and the tunnel did great. My dogs love the tunnel. I hide things in it as part of our playtime. They will never be trained to use this for racing, they are both goofy but they play in it. Hide from mommy is a favorite.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Fun for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: My 11 month old puggle loved to run through the cat's tunnel in the house, until he got too large to fit. I started looking for an agility tunnel and found this. My dogs love, love, love playing in this tunnel in the backyard (too big for indoor play unless you have a large room). I like that it comes with a carrying case for easy storage and transport. I have even packed it for trips to my parents house so the dogs would have something to play with there.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila B.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for your dog!
customer_reviews.text: The tunnel arrived today and seems very sturdy for the price. Our dog loves it and immediately ran through it several times. We use it as part of his agility training for fun and exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Dogs2

customer_reviews.title: Good find!
customer_reviews.text: This has been used inside on rainy days, as well as outdoors in the dogs fenced in area. Thus far it has survived two very exuberant boxers and an equally energetic 8 year old. The stakes are kind of useless, but we don't really have a need to use them.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: A ton of fun for our dog! Unfortunately the spikes don't stay in the ground in the back yard, so we just let her run through it without them. She's an 80 lb. german shepherd and LOVES this! It is so long though - if we put it indoors, it takes up our whole living room/kitchen! It probably won't last forever, but it seems pretty durable so far. Hard to bend into a circle, but works ok. Bought this to help my dog with the tunnel in agility.
customer_reviews.author: KathyP

customer_reviews.title: Happy Amazon client.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this Tunnel as it helps burn some of our Golden Retrievers energy. She caught on immediately and made about 10 runs. Great product, great price, great delivery, (next day).
customer_reviews.author: Prax Isaac Arcia

customer_reviews.title: Great company to work with
customer_reviews.text: Just received my tunnel yesterday and my dogs ran through it 4 times and the seam split by the tie down straps, but the company is making it right and sending me a replacement. I am going to get the weights to keep it in place and not use the stakes to hold it down. My pups love their new tunnel.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon R. DeMarco

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: I received this late 2018 and has survived for 6 months which may not seem long but I have pitties and they play rough so anything that lasts more than a week is amazing. They loved this tunnel, love to run through it, play hide and seek, jump on top of whoever is running through it, drag it around the yard , hide toys in it and just have a ball with it. I will be getting another
customer_reviews.author: Ami Glisson

customer_reviews.title: Great tunnel!!
customer_reviews.text: We just got this an hour ago and my kids and dogs are obsessed with it. I wanted andurable tunnel because my kids rip the flimsy toy tunnels. The pictures aren’t the best because the kids and dogs are rushing around. I just wanted everyone to see that it’s a good size. Fits a golden retriever and a 1 year old at the same time 😆
customer_reviews.author: megan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Great tunnel, great weight. I have two dogs that actually wrestle inside it and it holds up. I have no complaints. I find it a solid product, particularly for the price. The material isn't extremely durable, however I fold it up when not in use and it's lightweight, which I like.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: German Shepard approved agility tunnel
customer_reviews.text: Nothing more rewarding than seeing your dog's wagging tail !!! I own a large German Shepard and he absolutely LOVES his tunnel. Lightweight and VERY sturdy it's such an easy set up that it makes no excuses for skipping training. My dog tries to get in the tunnel even before I'm fully set up !!!
customer_reviews.author: KELLY M. PEARSON

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I know this says for dogs but I got it for my kids to play in. They love it so much! Good quality and easy to put away. Definitely worth the buy for the young kiddos.
customer_reviews.author: Clarissa

customer_reviews.title: It works but cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice light easy to use, but just does not hold up... my pup manage to jump up and lay on a portion of it... now the thing is not staying up on one of the ends. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: JChie

customer_reviews.title: Unsure of durability
customer_reviews.text: Handles to the bag was ripped when I unboxed the item. It is difficult to tie the closures alone. Waiting to see overall durability since the bag itself was ripped from the beginning
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: My Doxies Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my two Doxies to play in and under and they do! Very easy to manage and set up. Just as easy to fold and return it to the storage bag in which it arrived! Canvas tie downs with metal grommets are attached to the tunnel so you can secure it in place. However, I don't use the pegs, which are included and come in their own little bag, so the tunnel can move with the pups when they are playing in and under it! I would and have recommended this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Kfysman

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This tunnel is a lot bigger than I expected! It's easy to pop open and fairly easy to tie up for storage. The quality of the material seems great so far. My dog needed a little training to feel comfortable going through it, but now he loves it. Recommended for high energy dogs!
customer_reviews.author: BAH

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different tunnel - quality is questionable
customer_reviews.text: The tunnel is OK (just OK), but the metal spikes and grommets to tack this down to the grass and essentially worthless. The grommet tabs are all ripping off the tunnel and the spikes bend with any pressure at all. The tunnel will still work, but there is no way I would buy this again knowing how poor the quality is. Only reason I am not giving it one star is that the tunnel itself hasn't ripped yet.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Fun, puppies love it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to unpack & pack. Puppies love it! We only open it up when in use & training each evening. Easy to put away. It’s as light as a kite though, so don’t recommend leaving it out in any wind.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Benn

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and great exercise for your dog!
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy has blast with this in the yard! Its sturdy and provides entertain for the puppy and those watching her go nuts running in and out. Great exercise for your pet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MY DOGS LOVE THIS. THEY ARE HAVING THE BEST TIME EVER ...
customer_reviews.text: MY DOGS LOVE THIS. THEY ARE HAVING THE BEST TIME EVER now that they know what they are supposed to do. I bought this because I have 3 little dogs in agility training and I wanted to practice at home. I use a sqeeky toy to coax them in. It is built strong and durable and the bag to put it in and carry around is a plus. I thought it might be too long for the little dogs but they are actually having more fun looking for each other at the other end when I make a "c" shape.
customer_reviews.author: KATHY HOOGERWERF

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Well, 5 out of 6 did... the 6th was not sure about it... until I pulled out the treats then they all were running around and through it!! They slept well that night!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Great for practice!
customer_reviews.text: I love the long length of this tunnel and my dog loves it! For the price this is a great product but the overall quality is not the best, but I am still pleased with this purchase because there is no other tunnel on the market that is better quality for a reasonable price. Pros: lightweight, easy to carry, easy to take out of and put in carrying case, long, easy to make bends, cheap, great for practice Cons: thin fabric (rips easy), blows away in the wind if not staked down, not good for indoor use because moves while dog is running through.
customer_reviews.author: Piper425

customer_reviews.title: Served its purpose nicely
customer_reviews.text: I used it for a dog run , from the house doggie door to the large kennel 8x10 chain link in the back yard . Cut a hole in kennel & put zip ties through the tunnel attached to each other making sure to bend all chain link way back out the way not to injure my dogs and cat
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Brooks

customer_reviews.title: A must have for active dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put on my patio for the Jack Russell puppies we raise. This is a great way to exercise your pups! They run around and around it until they wear themselves out, then they use it for a sleep tent. It's very sturdy/breathable and I have left it out in the weather without a flaw. Very well worth the price and it will give you a lot of laughs watching your dogs play in and out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: good, but holes rip off easily
customer_reviews.text: Positive: it's a less expensive option for training your dog for agility. Negative: it's not durable. We are on our second one and the holes rip off way too easily. I've had to sew some back on, but it doesn't last. The tunnel itself is fine, though. Unfortunately, you kind of need the holes to keep the tunnel in place. Alternative option is to buy the weights to hold it down.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight beginnners tunnel
customer_reviews.text: Great little tunnel for keeping in the back yard. Collapsed and has ties to keep it secured, and the storage case has handles for carrying it around. Material is somewhat thin, so not sure how it's going to hold up in the long-run. Four sets of grommets on attacked tabs for attaching to stakes in the ground. Only negative is that the included stakes are teeny tiny and do not really hold the grommets well. Used different stakes from a tent and things worked out fine.
customer_reviews.author: MBCheck

customer_reviews.title: Neko loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My dog, Neko, loves this tunnel! It's portable, easy to set up, fold, and carry in its case, and it's holding up pretty good for our dog's many times dashing through it. I'm glad I purchased the 18 ft. tunnel and not a shorter one because he loves to run through the entire long length.
customer_reviews.author: RFB

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat at this price!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this can't be beat. I was looking for a tunnel to work with my dog in the backyard and was debating on buying this or spending another hundred and change to buy a higher quality one. Upon reading the material of the mid hundred dollar tunnels it wasn't worth the extra amount. I purchased this tunnel for my Australian Shepherd and Australian Cattle dog. My Aussie loves it, the other is still a little skeptical.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: My dog love it!
customer_reviews.text: We are enjoying a lot our new agility course in the backyard, including this tunnel! It is wonderful, the material seems durable, it is really easy to fold and install. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money. It won't last forever but if used under supervision it will last a long time. The dogs like it when I throw a ball through and they can chase it. It isn't hard to put away or get out when you want to play.
customer_reviews.author: gwendolin

customer_reviews.title: Dog Tunnel
customer_reviews.text: The tunnel is long and I love the material. It's great. My only problem with it is that it's stained because of the packaging. The metal hoops (the small ones made to put the metal poles in so the tunnel holds in place) are rusted and caused the material to have rust stains. There's also black spots in places and I can't identify what caused those. Although it's pretty stained, I'm not going to take it back because it'll eventually get dirty outdoors anyway, and at least it doesn't have any holes in it. However, I can see people being upset over those things...
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. A

customer_reviews.title: Happy puppy! Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: This tunnel is perfect and my Cavalier King Charles/Shih Tzu mix puppy loves it as well as his friends. The handle on the carry bag was coming apart so I wrote to the seller and they extremely promptly sent me a replacement carry bag. GREAT customer service!! The 18 foot length is wonderful because you can adapt it to many configurations, even using it zigzag around poles or linking one room in the house to another. I would highly recommend it. We've even had 2 dogs running thru it and playfully tumbling all the way thru it as they made it thru the tunnel.
customer_reviews.author: loves to bake

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is loving this! She has taken an agility course and lost her mind when she saw this. Time will tell how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Officer Nosey

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Really long!
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty oversized for my dogs ability but it is really well made and we are working towards training my dog to go through it!
customer_reviews.author: Anna in Baltimore

customer_reviews.title: Puppy approved
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time, as described and in new condition. My puppies love to play with this item indoors! Tube time is a valued part of our weekend and can be used in our small apartment! Fun for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: B4Me

customer_reviews.title: Ultra fun for Flemish Giant Rabbit!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased tunnel for 20 pound Flemish Giant Rabbit. He outgrew the smaller one. He loves it! Runs back and forth through it and then settles in for a rest! Haven't had it long enough to see how durable it is, but so far it's great!
customer_reviews.author: CEP

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: The tunnel is exactly what we were hoping for. It came with stakes to anchor it to the ground, and can be manipulated easily in a multitude of shapes. It's also simple to fold up and stores small. Our puppy loves it! We cannot wait for spring so we can set it up outside.
customer_reviews.author: LeftCoastLiggy

customer_reviews.title: Fun from the moment we opened the package
customer_reviews.text: Fun from the moment we opened the package! Our short legged Jack Russell ran right in and my boys crawled in after him... Now they have taught the dog to fetch his toys from inside! It's bigger and better quality than I expected for the price, and the carrying case is really nice. Collapses flat for easy storage in a small space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner tunnel but don’t expect to be long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Seam open and stain on fabric. I will repair and try to clean stain from fabric. Still good value for product. Comes with storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Built for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I had been looking for a child's play tunnel because we thought it would be cheaper. This tunnel has been exactly what we needed. It is made of a thicker canvas material so the dogs nails don't rip or snag it. Also, my favorite part, is the grommets and stakes to keep the tunnel in place. When the dogs are running through the tunnel the stakes keep it from sliding across the ground or from rolling. I would buy this item again, but I doubt I will have to, this is a well made item!
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great dog agility toy.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love it. They were scared at first but after filling it with treats, and getting real excited when they went through it, they tend to hang out inside just for fun now. If it’s still scary to them, start by shortening it up and expanding it with time.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Carr

customer_reviews.title: Great tunnel
customer_reviews.text: I love this tunnel. I ordered it for my kids to practice with for their 4-H agility class and then I also used it at the local county fair for the 4-H agility show. My kids love the tunel because you can roll it out and have a straight tunnel or put a curve in it like the picture shows. We used the tunnel at the show for about 10 dogs from miniture to larger labs and all the dogs were able to go through it just fine. The tunnel held up well and doesn't look any worse for wear. Great tunnel for the price!
customer_reviews.author: mb78

customer_reviews.title: Happy boxer!
customer_reviews.text: The quality is very cheap and I can already see seems that will soon come apart. That said.... by boxer LOVES this thing. You could literally see the smile on his face as he would charge full-speed into the tunnel, stop in the middle to hunch down then launch out the other end and sprint 3 times around the yard, Very entertaining, It wont last but now that I know he likes it I will purchase a better quality next time.
customer_reviews.author: ECHO444

customer_reviews.title: Weak eye hole hooks
customer_reviews.text: The hook holes for the tunnel are we weak one ripped off in the front so that messed it up to stay in place. Can’t return it either.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs love this!
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs were scared of it at first, but after I got down on my hands and knees with them for the first time, they are constantly running through it. We have two large dogs - a golden retriever and a golden retriever/malamute/wolf mix. Both dogs run through the tube at the same time with no issues, and the tube is dirty but in great condition (i.e., no tearing or holes). Definitely worth the money. I enjoy watching them play in it.
customer_reviews.author: akOSU

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, long tunnel for agility training. My dog loves running through it over and over again. Make sure you use the stakes to hold it down well or your dog might get tripped up in it like mine did once when she ran through it before I finished setting it up. What's really cool about this tunnel is how small it can be when collapsed for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Practice Tunnel!
customer_reviews.text: Gifted this to a friend who opened it at my house. My whippet & pit mix were dashing through before it was even fully extended! This is a practice tunnel, not competition weight, and just right for supervised home & yard use. Really wonderful addition to the backyard agility course.
customer_reviews.author: N...

customer_reviews.title: Good tunnel, but lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I like this tunnel. My German Shepherd likes the tunnel. The only warning I would have it is very light weight so must be tied down. I used it in the house a couple of times and my dog got caught in it because she was running so fast through it and I couldn't stake it into the floors. It does not telescope, but does collapse easily to store back in its holder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I figure it will be fun for a toddler to chase after them
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for two very active pomskies and after a little coaching they learned to run through the tunnel. I figure it will be fun for a toddler to chase after them, fun indoor activity for winter. It looks like it will wear well, it is easy to pack/unpack and it stores easily in the closet. Overall I am very happy with the price and the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dogs just wanna have fun!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this tunnel. As soon as I open it, they're waiting at the ends to go through. It has fastener grommets so you can shorten this tunnel or use stakes to keep it in place/position. It is very lightweight and has a convenient carrying case. Easy to get back in the case too.
customer_reviews.author: Sarpoodle

customer_reviews.title: Success!
customer_reviews.text: My corgi loves it. Well,one of them. The other is still afraid, but it only was delivered today, and he's already warming up to it. My kid (12) also got in the tunnel and enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: LooLoo

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My standard size golden doodle loves running through this tunnel! Sometimes he doesn't even wait for me to put the stakes in the ground to stabilize it.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3 teens

customer_reviews.title: LONG tunnel
customer_reviews.text: FYI - 18 feet is pretty darn long! This is great, especially for the price. It collapses to the size of a hula hoop, and even has little strings attached to tie it up for storage. The metal spikes/ties that come with it to help keep the tunnel fixed to the ground are nice, but would come out of the eye hole fairly easily. I just bent the spikes around the eye holes so they are always attached (now I can't loose them too). Our 4 and 12 year old dogs love this thing - though the 12 year old likes to jump on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: CLTGUY

product_meta.title: HDP 18 Ft Dog Agility Training Open Tunnel
product_meta.description: This is a BRAND NEW 18 ft long with 24" opening dog agility training tunnel. The blue cover is made from durable intertwine wove oxford Dacron. Steel spring set diameter is 3mm. Grommets are made from steel, not plastic. Short stake design, will not scratch your pet. Tunnel is AKC compliant. What in the box: one 18' dog tunnel, one carry case with clear plastic pouch, eight stakes packed in a pouch.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
